name: Haddock Citrine
author: lobstah_luva
summary: This dish uses oranges with haddock which is a change from most dishes that use lemon with fish or seafood. It's a nice refreshing change. It pairs well with veggies, like asparagus, broccoli, or zucchini. For starch you could do mashed or roasted potatoes, risotto or couscous.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon salt-free seasoning blend (such as Mrs. Dash®)
2 tablespoons buttery spread (such as Smart Balance®), melted
directions: Arrange haddock fillets in a large baking dish
Pour orange juice over fish and cover with plastic wrap, reserve orange zest
Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Stir panko bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, buttery spread, parsley, thyme, and reserved orange zest in a bowl until well mixed
Bake in the preheated oven until fish is easily flaked with a fork and topping is golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes
Allow fish to rest 5 minutes before serving
